review_text: Kimberly is a great host! This was our third time staying there! Very peaceful. We will return again!

Kimberly was an absolute breeze to book with. Communication was prompt and she was very accommodating. The home was exactly as described. It was clean, cozy, and had all the amenities to make it feel like an extension of our home. The location was also secluded yet easily accessible and the view was unbeatable. We will be booking here next year for sure, can't wait!
Great place to stay and relax, amazing views

This is a special place. Beautifully maintained bright and airy with wonderful seaway river views and access. We dropped our kayaks in from the small dock, a little tricky with low water levels but totally doable as the dock is new and very sturdy. We also explored nearby trails as recommended in the guest book. Very comfortable and clean accommodation.

We had such a wonderful time during our stay! We enjoyed the firepit, the neighbors, the wildlife was quite plentiful. We got to see at least 3 ships per day going through of various sizes and so many beautiful sailboats on the water. We snorkeled, swam, fished; saw minks, a fox, deer, a wood chuck, loons, cormorants, red squirrels, chipmunks, crayfish a plenty and so much more. We enjoyed the ease of the kitchen space that we chose to eat in most of the time. We got great firewood from the amish saw mill up where the guest book told us to go with the cheapest price in town of $3 per bundle; they even had maple syrup there too for sale. We werent far from alex bay, or black river. It was a great trip and we really loved how cute and clean Kimberly's place is. We prepared ourselves for needing everything, but she truly already had everything there that we would need in the kitchen, bedroom and bathroom.
Wonderful place! Fantastic views! Second time staying here, and it won’t be the last! Thanks again Kimberly!

Could not of been happier with our decision to stay at the cottage. Inside we had everything that we could’ve needed and on the outside we had an absolutely beautiful view of the river. Already looking forward to booking the cottage again next year.
Amazing Location if you were the river in Canada was very nice. The porch is grade to eat on with the view. The sunsets are amazing to watch from the porch.
If you need a relaxing get-away, this is it! Beautiful cottage, quaint small towns, small farms, and long country roads. Tough to get to it, but worth the 3 hour drive north of Rochester.

This is a beautiful cottage, very clean and well-appointed. We brought our own sheets and towels because that’s what we’re used to, but if we hadn’t they would have been provided for us. Lots of windows and beautiful views of the river.. I looked forward to the sailboats launching from Brockville Ontario on the far side of the St Laurence every day at 6pm. We found it to be a great base for exploring Sacketts Harbor historical sites, and Wellesley Island. Kitchen had everything you need in terms of appliances, utensils, and pots and pans. Kimberly responded immediately to any questions we had - Fire TV was new to us and we needed a bit of help. We highly recommend this charming property and our host.
Lovely cottage on the water. Neighbors were friendly and the dogs had plenty of space to be dogs!
Great little river cottage on the St. Lawrence.
This was our 2nd stay. Can’t recommend it more highly. Cottage is perfection with wonderful hosts.
Lovely cottage, lovely view of the river and ships. Kitchen had everything we needed. We did lots of cooking, loved eating on the porch! Thank you for sharing this wonderful place with others!

We had such an amazing stay at Kimberly’s home! Absolutely gorgeous view with a cozy, clean, and comfortable home. Kimberley was helpful and flexible with our needs. We would absolutely stay here again!
As advertised, beautiful place in a lovely location. Kimberly was great. Would return!
Lovely home, great view and wonderful host. Couldn't have had a better time.

We’ve now stayed 4 times and loved every time. The homes’ position on the river is magical, the simple design and airiness are some of our favorite aspects. Also, especially with kids, the state park down the street is a dream! Best playground! Kids love the house, too. It’s well equipped, cozy and just one of our favorite places to be. Thanks Kimberly!

Wonderful cottage right on the riverfront. We especially enjoyed meals out on the deck/patio and the nice grill. It’s a comfortable, peaceful place for working remotely as well, particularly the cozy window seat. The views of the river can’t be beat and the kitchen is open and spacious. It was difficult to leave!

Beautiful views, cozy home, I don't know what else I can add beyond all the other glowing reviews. It was our second time staying here and it's just such a wonderful place to spend a weekend. I would highly recommend it! Everything looks exactly as in the pictures and the scenery is beautiful. Be sure to spend and afternoon walking around Alexandria Bay, such a cute town, and just down the road!

Well appointed, tastefully decorated, steady wifi, good appliances, easy access, nice neighbors.
Hosts are good folks.

Amazing water front home outside of Alexandria Bay. Home was even nicer than expected. We enjoyed a quite weekend with lots of space for our dog to run. Nice trails and State Park just a few minutes away . Home is lovely with everything a small family would need. Wonderful views of river and Canada ..... don’t miss the beautiful sunsets over the water.

The pictures don’t do this place justice. The perfect slice of heaven hidden away from the busy life. Perfect for a weekend getaway or just to get away. Kimberly literally thought of everything! From the moment we arrived to the minute we left we were in awe. Love, love, love!!!

This is a great little place on the river. Clean open romantic and a terrific place on the river. We stayed for 9 days, as we had both a wedding and reunion to attend. The view of the sunset and river are beautiful and sitting on the porch having coffee each morning was the tranquility that keeps you sane. We mixed in some day trips to local places with the kids, it was a good mix to keep them happy and busy. This is a very good value for the space and the amenities and if you stay you will have no regrets.
Such a wonderful cottage! The location was amazing, nice and peaceful! Lots of activities and local attractions! Will rent again the next time I am in this area!!

Beyond our expectations. Beautiful cabin with all of the comforts of home right on the river. Our two toddler girls, dog and my husband and I fit comfortably. The open living/kitchen layout really worked for us for the kids. We loved the grounds and of course the incredible views of the river. Wonderful vistas from every window. We were in town to visit family vacationing in the area and enjoyed a large family meal grilling steaks and sitting on the porch while the sun set. Loved the close proximity to the park for the girls. Can’t say enough good things. Cottage impeccably kept. Thank you!

This cottage on the river is even more beautiful than the pictures! The location is central to attractions yet private. The cottage includes everything needed for a great get away, including maps and guides, suggestions and much more. The host is quick to respond to questions and makes sure you have a great stay at their property!
The cottage is a great spot to escape for some relaxation. The view and atmosphere is what brought us here, and will most likely bring us back.

Absolutely amazing week we had!! The place is beautiful, the sunset is breathtaking. The river being that close is great. Coffee in the mornings with the view of the river,. There are no words to describe how wonderful that was. EVERYTHING was perfect!! The new added AC in the master bedroom is perfect and pretty much the only AC you will ever need in that house! Even though we didn't get to meet Kimberly, she made sure to stay in contact with us to make sure we were doing ok. Everyone is so nice!!! Definitely will be back.
This is a wonderful location for a calm and relaxing get away. Highly recommended.
This was our second time staying here. Excellent location and beautiful views.

This river cottage is dreamy, exactly the right size - not too small or too large. The views of the river, watching the weather, the occasional barge, and night skies are worth the visit alone; We spent a good deal of time exploring the trails at the state park nearby and visiting the new Blue Heron Trail at the Red Barn. Both spots are close to the cottage. This is a great space!

The cottage has a beautiful view, and was very cozy and clean. The stay was peaceful and relaxing (just what we were looking for). Kimberly responded quickly to our questions, and made us feel quite at home. We would stay there again.
A private oasis on the river. The atmosphere was so relaxing and the view is spectacular. A great place for some needed relaxation!
Perfect place to get away for relaxation. Area had a lot to offer and the view was amazing.

Located in a picturesque spot on the St. Lawrence river, the house is light and airy and takes advantage of the surrounding views. Very comfortable accommodations with everything you need to relax and feel at home.
Kim was very responsive with communication and the house was clean and ready as expected when we arrived.
We will definitely plan on a future visit.

This house on the beautiful Saint Lawrence River is so lovely I almost hate to tell people about it because I don’t want it to become so popular a destination that I am not able to get to spend time there when I want to! It is a gorgeous home with all the amenities ,spectacular view, privacy without isolation, quality, comfort, tranquility, Proximity to local attractions... it is a home away from home . It is cozy in the fall and comfortable in the summer ;it is pet friendly and people friendly . It is spacious without being too much to handle. So much nicer than any hotel room ,Nestled in nature with wildlife abounding.It is full of light and From any given window you might see oceangoing vessels, or sailboats or fisherman, or deer or black squirrels or chipmunks or many different species of birds or waterfowl . It’s simply paradise!

A lovely cottage and beautiful location, with a stunning view of the St. Lawrence river and Canada. The house has plenty of space for a family to stay and such a bonus to have the use of a washer and dryer! Would definitely book this location again!
This cottage is beautifully designed with many lovely touches and great views of the River. We highly recommend it.

Beautiful cottage on the river. Very quaint, private, and obviously well-loved. Spent a long week here with my wife and our small children and had a great time playing in the water, paddling in the kayaks, traveling around the area, and sitting by the fire. Thanks Kimberly!

We have been renting cottages in the 1000 Islands for several years, I have to say our stay here was the best. The home is nicely decorated and comfortable in every way. Well stocked kitchen was a joy to be in. It was very quiet during our stay, something we really enjoyed. The owner's sister and father were friendly and helpful with any questions we had. We enjoyed visits from their dogs Bear and Lu. I don't know if we have ever been this relaxed on a vacation! We will be looking forward to spending more time here in the future. Thank you so much for opening your wonderful home to us!

Kimberly's place was perfect for what we were looking for. Fantastic access to the river, a spacious backyard and beautiful home. Felt very secluded but was pretty close to stores and other things. My suggestion: if you're planning on coming in the summer and you want to rent a boat, make sure you call ahead. We didn't, and there were none available. All in all, everything we were looking for and more.

Perfect getaway if you want a private hideaway , or if you need a place close to all the North country attractions. So much nicer than all the hotels and less expensive too. The home itself is lovely and comfortable with a gorgeous view of the river and Brockville on the Canadian side. You’ll need nothing but your clothes—and food. Sit on the porch and watch the big ships or the small boats go by while you drink your coffee or sip your wine . You have your own dock with private access to the river for swimming or kayaking . From the moment I arrived I felt at home and I so hated to leave; in fact, before we left, we booked another long weekend there. It was the most peaceful, refreshing vacation I have ever had, and I have done a lot of traveling all over the world; however this stress-free, low-key five days on the St. Lawrence River left me with a feeling of serenity like no other.

We had a lovely stay at the cottage on the river! The hosts graciously allowed us to use their personal kayaks on the river. We enjoyed using the fire ring down by the river. All of the windows provided a beautiful view and made the rooms so cheery! One down side although was the fact that there were no curtains in the upstairs bathroom and three of the bedroom windows. We never did find anymore than one wash cloth and ended up buying some. All in all we had a great time, just a bit disappointing.

If you're looking for a spectacular view of the St. Lawrence river from a beautiful, spacious yard, this is the place for you! Kimberley's home is comfortable and clean. It's location in Morristown is only 10 miles from the larger town of Ogdensburg, which has numerous shopping options. We appreciated the neighbors on both sides, who offered helpful tips. All in all, we enjoyed a memorable week!

This was an absolutely awesome place. Very quaint and secluded right on the river. I was impressed with the cleanliness and all the amenities. It is also located about 1.5mi from the Jacques Cartier State Park which has some good walking trails. I highly recommend this place as a good get away in the North Country of New York!
Beautiful place, very quiet, not far from Ottawa, very comfy.

What a beautiful cottage! Very relaxing comfortable and cozy. Loved sitting by the window and watching for the ships come through!! Amazing time will definitely come back!! Thank you for sharing a beautiful place with us!
We loved being right on the St Lawrence river and in close proximity to so many outdoor attractions
Cozy, clean and comfortable cottage! Well stocked, great views, so quiet and peaceful! Easy communication! We will be back!

We loved this place! The view was beautiful an we made good use of the covered deck for coffee, meals, wine, and reading!! It is a very quiet spot and the house was perfect for our needs. Kimberly was always quick to respond and the check in/check out was easy. We would definitely stay here again!
Beautiful setting, easy check in, and wonderful having a full kitchen and lovely deck to enjoy meals!

Once again, we very much enjoyed our stay at Kimberly's river cottage. The place was charming, clean and equipped with everything we needed. I just love the windows and the views of the St. Lawrence. Thanks Kimberly , your cottage was perfect!

Fantastic, secluded getaway with a beautiful view of the St. Lawrence River. It was lovely waking up each morning with a cool breeze and the sound of the river and birds singing. The place is very spacious and clean, perfect for a couple, family or group of friends.

Beautiful location in the Thousand Islands. Nice and quiet, with plenty of space to enjoy the outdoors. We took advantage of kayaks, BBQ, and fire pit. Kim was very prompt with communication. Place was cozy and clean.

I have stayed her many times when visiting my daughter and now my son at St. Lawrence University. I travel from Ohio so I like to make it a mini vacation. Love this house. It is about 35-40 min from St. Lawrence University. My daughter graduated this year so it's the first time I spent time in May here. Very lovely. We were fortunate with the weather. All you have to do is pack up your clothes. Nothing else is needed. Enjoy the local farms and the farm stands for your vegetables!!! We picked up some asparagus just before we left!!!

Kimberly is a very responsive host. She responded to emails very quickly and was more than accommodating. The house was wonderful. I'm a cooker and found the kitchen to be fully equipped; right down to a double boiler and crock pot. We were up for Family Weekend at St. Lawrence Univ. and loved our stay. We were able to sit down to a home cooked meal instead of going through the hassle of restaurant reservations. The house has wonderful space and a lot of light coming in through the windows. Sipping morning coffee and gazing out at the St. Lawrence River (which really is right there!) was such a treat. We're thinking about coming back in the summer to tour Ottawa and the Thousand Islands. There's even a vineyard about 20 minutes up the road in Ogdensburg that does wine tasting and has wonderful wines. We highly recommend this homey cottage. It certainly is more than a place to hang your head. It's a home away from home.
Kimberly's sister and father live next door and they were so welcoming! Love their 2 dogs and my little dog loved them as well. Great hosts!

Beautiful property on the water with views of Canada. A few spiders in the house, but nothing a little bug spray couldn't fix. Fun restaurant only a couple miles away and an easy drive down to Alex Bay and Clayton. Would definitely recommend this place to others!

The cottage had everything we could possibly need. It was tastefully decorated, cozy and very clean. Loved all the windows and views of the river. The bedroom balcony was perfect for stargazing. The setting was quiet and peaceful...just what we were looking for.

My family and I had such a lovely time at this air bnb property. The home is very inviting and has so much charm. There are plenty of windows so you have an amazing view of the St Lawrence river whether you're cooking a meal or relaxing in the living room. The rental has everything you need for a comfortable and relaxing stay. I would highly recommend this listing to anyone and we would gladly stay there again!

This cottage exceeded any expectation we had! Kimberly knew we were on our honeymoon and was sweet enough to leave us a bottle of champagne! The view was absolutely stunning from the back yard, we spent every single night out there with a fire going. It was beautiful. The neighbors on either side were absolutely sweet and inviting. It was very very homey. The cottage was adorable and had everything you could need for a vacation. We absolutely will keep this place in mind for the next chance we have for a vacation. It was unlike anywhere we had ever been. I cannot say thank you enough!

My boyfriend and I, along with another couple stayed here for two nights for Memorial Day Weekend and couldn't have asked for anything better!! The house was very easy to find, very clean, and had an amazing view. It was so perfect for playing outdoor games, barbecuing, and bonfires at night. Kim was always available if we had questions and was even nice enough to check in and make sure everything was ok. We cannot wait to plan another weekend getaway here and were so incredibly pleased with the best weekend!! Thanks Kim!

Kimberley, The Cottage was so nice. The light and views were stunning. We were sorry we couldn't spend more time. It was too far from Canton and the university. I am hoping when Elizabeth graduates you are still renting your place so we can stay again.
Margie

Such a beautiful place to stay. Kimberly was flexible with arrival and departure times. My son and I came for parents weekend to see my daughter at St. Lawrence Univ so this was a beautiful little short vacation for us. The pictures don't do it justice. Full kitchen was lovely because I love to cook. I can't wait to stay here again!

We had a lovely stay at the cottage. The space is much nicer than the pictures can show. It was airy and comfortable. The master suite upstairs has a wonderful balcony, which was perfect for watching the stunning sunsets and viewing the Milky Way overhead on a clear night. Kimberly was wonderful, and her relatives are nearby (with their adorable dogs) if you need anything. The house had everything we needed.
It is a great, private spot to relax by the water, but it's also in a great location for seeing the North Country. We went as far as Alexandria Bay in one direction and the Eisenhower Dam in Massena in the other. A few notes about touring: there are several Amish communities nearby, so you will see buggies on the roads and in parking lots. There is a nice general store in Heuvelton that sells a lot of Amish crafts. Also, check out Mares Wares on Route 37. Marianne sells locals artists' work, as well as her own pottery. If you are lucky, you can sign up for a lesson! Of course, the Remington Museum in Ogdensburg is remarkable. The whole area is quite rural, so be prepared for long stretches of farmland and tiny little towns.
All in all, we had a wonderful time. Thank you!
Kimberly was very good at communicating and very flexible with arrangements. The house is on a beautiful stretch of the St. Lawrence. The house had everything I needed.

This home is truly a gem and right on the St. Lawrence river. Simply beautiful! We roasted s'mores and watched the gorgeous sunsets over the river for several nights during our stay. There was a master suite upstairs with a full bath and a bedroom with bunk beds downstairs with a half bath. We enjoyed the kitchen with a gas stove, dishwasher, large refrigerator and microwave. Beautiful hard wood floors throughout and a fireplace too, which we did not use as it never was cold enough to warrant this. One tip: the water has a mineral taste so we purchased bottled water to drink during our stay. I would definitely stay here again!

This cottage is lovely, clean, comfortable and set well back away from the road. We cooked most meals there over our 2 night stay, the kitchen is fully equipped. We had a late frost so the wood burning fireplace added both heat and ambiance. The neighbour, relatives of the owners, was friendly and helpful answering our questions. We set up games on the lawn, had a BBQ, sat by the fire pit and watch an amazing sunset over the St. Lawrence. Next time we will stay longer and bring the dog!

We absolutely loved staying at Kimberly's home on the Saint Lawrence River. The home was beautiful, cozy and clean, and the view was amazing! Our son was graduating from St. Lawrence University and it was the perfect place to stay. We had a lovely family dinner there, and the well cared for lawn was ideal for frisbee and other games.
I want to pick up the house (and the view) and move it to Maine, so I can live like we did that weekend all the time! Thank you Kimberly!

My mom and I stayed at the River Cottage for 2 nights in mid Nov. The cottage was very quiet and cozy for our stay. We enjoyed watching the ship activity especially while having breakfast in the great little breakfast nook. We didn't end up doing any real cooking there, but there is a full kitchen. When we arrived late afternoon, at dusk, there were a couple of lights on and the heat was going which was very welcoming. Kimberly was very easy to reach by e-mail/text when I had questions. I would stay here again if I am back in the area visiting my niece at St Lawrence University. The beds were very comfortable and the cottage was very quiet.

We enjoyed staying at the River Cottage so much that we wanted to move in! It was the best part of our first visit to the 1000 Islands area. We thank our hosts for providing a lovely stay and the perfect view of the St. Lawrence Seaway. We felt right at home and love this house. It was very quiet and the view from the balcony was spectacular. Travel guides were left on the coffee table in the living room and gave us tips on how to tour the area. Thank you for making our vacation the best ever!
The house was lovely and the location on the river was charming.

Such a great place to stay, really quiet and such a great space! Huge for two people but we loved it. Kimberly was always a quick text away and very responsive! Check in was really easy and we got there late at night but still found it easily.
Kimberly was easy to communicate with and very flexible. The cottage was everything that we expected and more. It was hard to leave such a lovely spot.

This place is so much better then the pictures!
it is on the river, has a great lawn and you can see the river from every room.
the place is very welcoming, we stayed a family of 4 (kids are 4yr, 1yr) and had plenty of space. the internal design is so very smart, you can see the river from everywhere.
thousand islands area is a quick 25 minutes drive where one can take a tour of the islands.
note that there is no way to the river from the yard to actually swim in it , but it's a great place to sit back and watch the ships go by...

This is an absolutely beautiful cottage. Very quiet and the views are amazing. You can even see geese eating a few meters away. It rained the second night but we didn't mind as the living space is very cosy. I think my only regret was not having blinds or drapes in the bedrooms but that is it - am already looking forward to our next trip.

Also, when doing groceries - best place we found is in Ogdensburg at Price Choppers.

The cabin was very cute and cozy. Very nicely furnished, clean and well equipped. The neighbors were friendly and we felt very safe there. We enjoyed the quiet setting and the views of the river. We were sorry that there was no easy access to the river from the cabin. We had a fantastic time at the cabin.

This cottage is terrific! It's lovely. It's safe. It's peaceful. The view of the St. Lawrence is beautiful. The owners and the people who live nearby are really nice. The design and decor of the cottage are terrific. Seriously, it's a great little cottage!
Very nice place with awesome view. Great for relaxing.
Excellent value and great host
Super clean is a win for me. Thanks Susan
Great spot right in the centre of town, reminiscent of the capsule hotel/hostels in Japan. Clean and had some food,coffee, snacks etc. cool little spot !
Had a nice home feel and was just what you might need if you are passing through.
Very clean, great atmosphere. I highly recommend it to anyone travelling solo to Prescott, ON.

I needed a safe place to stop over so I wouldn’t have to drive home at night and found this little hotel in Prescott. Everything was super clean and there were a lot of thoughtful details. Easy self check in. The other guests were quiet and polite.

Great Stay! The Zens Inn is in a great location near the water with easy access to many dining options. Once you enter this amazingly unique space you’ll notice how spotless everything is kept not only in the common areas but in the bedrooms as well. Other guests were a pleasure to be around and the beds are nice and comfortable. Would 100% recommend and stay again.
Great place
Great spot!:-)
Unique boutique experience. Clean and pleasant environment
it was my second time staying at Josee's place and I enjoyed it :) Great place to stay for a night when you are traveling !
Super comfy bed. A bit bright for sleeping for me. Just what I needed for a quick stay. Nice common area and had some great chats with other quests.
Lovely place that has everything.
Very clean and very easy to find. I enjoyed my stay, thank you.
everything was great, he recommends this place for everyone

Amazing place very clean and quiet… hosts are both very helpful… awesome spot beds are very comfortable… will stay here again 100% thanks guys… open concept modern and great location beside the water with excellent access to restaurants and other amenities

LOVED this place. Zen Inn is so unique. It felt like a boutique hotel combined with a Japanese guesthouse. Everything was spotless and being able to have your private space plus space where you might chat with other guests is wonderful. Josee has thought of every detail to cater to your comfort from a handful of amenities in your room, in case you forgot something, to an array of breakfast items to have and a plethora of other thoughtful touches that make your stay extremely easy and comfortable. Keycode entry is fantastic! I loved the exposed brick and high ceilings of the common area and the overhead shower is very cool. I can't say enough positive things about this one of a kind place to stay that was perfect for this single traveler.

Josee's place is brand new. It is sparkling
clean. The linens are a brilliant white. The furniture in the common room that is blue very clean no stains. The rooms are abit compact basically for sleeping. When I was staying there there was me and one other guy so in the evening the whole place was to myself. In the morning he was not friendly but that was OK. The washrooms are in the food area. The bathing rooms are off the dorm rooms in the sleeping area. Joee's place is great if you need a clean place to stay for a night or a couple of nights. If you come in a group it works better for company in the common area. Everything is as advertised there is a good variety of breads, muffins, and bagels with a variety of spreads jams, Nutella and butter. Josee is very friendly she will explain anything about the town you want to know. And she is available by cell phone 24/7 if you have an issue.
Comfortable, clean and with a very large common kitchen lounge area. A great place to stop by

Great location in Prescott, right in the heart of the place. It is quite a nice concept. The place was super clean and the beds where comfy.
Definitely would go back there again if needed.
A great place to rest for the night!
Very cool spot. Interesting concept Very clean and tidy. Well organized. I’d stay again for sure!

I was there for my brother's wedding. Josse provided me with a place that is another airbnb in her home when the Inn was full. She answers messages promptly. Very, very generous. After seeing her place gave me ideas to improve our home.
Thank you for such a peaceful and beautiful stay.
great place 👌
Clean, comfortable, convenient - it was a great place to rest during a busy week!
Great place.

Great place for single travellers looking for a clean, affordable night sleep. At least, this was what I was looking for. It has everything you can hope for, including a free simple continental breakfast. Also, a guest fridge you can use for groceries. Wifi is very reliable. Highly recommended
Great place. See my other review. It’s my second time here
only negative point for me. I think the bedroom area is very poorly insulated. We could hear everything.
Very nice place
Had another wonderful stay. Hosts are great to communicate with, great location, comfy beds, fabulous showers and terrific breakfast items to choose from. I’ll be back…
nothing flashy, a comfortable bed and a hot shower for a road trip. very quick to get back to 401 as well. will definitely stay again when I head this way

I really enjoyed my stay at this place. Very clean, very comfy bed, great showers and very relaxed atmosphere. I also enjoyed visiting with the other guests, having breakfast and watching tv in the common area. I will be returning… in the near future in fact. Thank you.
I really suggest this place. Very clean, very good location and communication is excellent. The host is very helpful and attentive.

Beautiful small rooms, perfect for spending the night. Walls are thin so you can hear your neighbors but everybody tried to be very quiet during the night time. Clean and spacious bathrooms. Perfect small breakfast opportunities. Thanks!

Perfect for a brief overnight stay en-route to or from the U.S. or else where in Canada. Convenient location for the border crossing just a few mins away. Very clean with ample amenities to prepare your own food etc.

Despite nice common spaces and easy self check-in, we were very disappointed by our experience here. We booked the place as a rest stop, to get a good night’s sleep in the middle of a long journey. The bed was tiny (small single), the small room (a plywood box) had no ventilation or air flow, and we were awoken at 8 am by banging and a power drill in the plywood wall next to our heads.
It would be feasible for one guest if you just need a place to sleep, but not at these rates.

Great little place, right location ,fair price for great value with all the amenities for any travellers, sure hope to return whenever visiting area just steps away from Brockville . Recommended as great alternative to any hotel

A great concept. Modern and minimalist, clean, quiet. Room is small, but who needs more? It was fun and cozy and felt safe - although that depends on who else is sharing the hotel on the night you are there. Recommend!!

I work as a travel nurse and was looking for a comfortable and safe place to sleep between shifts. This place is very cute , clean and modern. Loved the blue lights under the bed. I felt very safe here and the bed and linens were so comfortable, like a 5star hotel. They go the extra mile to offer towels, disposable toothbrushes and paste. Headphones for a quiet sleep and more. There was coffee for breakfast and fresh croissants and breads. Great price and a wonderful Airbnb spot to rest! I would 110% recommend and go back!
This place definitely stands out- funky, modern, convenient, and very clean!
Excellent service and a different experience. I also met with Josee. She is an amazing lady. Thanks!
Great place to stay.
exceptional value really very clean lunches included its excellent:-)
Great place, great value. Perfect for the single traveller. It’s a bit like a hostel for adults with private rooms. Great coffee machine and other facilities. I wish there were more places like this.
The place is very very nice and super clean. If you are fir shirt stay please go and try it out.
Nice place, newly renovated, nice showers and kitchen facilities, great value, beds are a little small.
This place is a perfect stop, if you’re staying here or you just need a cheap place to stay the night on your journey.
The facility was exactly as described. It was perfect for the short stay. The check in process was great. It was clean and quiet. I will certainly be back on my next trip into Prescott.
The location was great, close to the #401. Very clean and quiet. The room was pretty small but comfortable.
Very stylish. Communication and checkin went without a hitch. Guests were respectful of quiet hours. Just found the bedroom very hot despite the fan.

Felt very comfortable there. Everything was well laid out. You walk into the location and it almost feels like a Starbucks. Everything there was clean and neat. Everything you could ask for if you’re traveling as a single.

PROS:
I had a wonderful 2-night stay over the weekend! The suite was much nicer than I had anticipated. I saw from the pictures that there was a Keurig, but hadn’t realized there were already coffee pods available and stopped at a grocery store on my way to the rental to buy some. I really appreciate little conveniences like that. I also hadn’t even realized until I first arrived that there was an oven, but be careful if you decide to cook anything in it, because the smoke detector is right by it and is very sensitive. I set the alarm off twice…the first time the oven was completely empty (and looked like it’s never been used) and I was just opening the oven to put something in and it went off immediately and scared the crap out of me lol, but I assume they are able to control the alarm remotely, because both times it went off, it only rang twice and then the noise stopped. Definitely got my heart racing for a few seconds 😂. Also, the fridge was perfect, but the freezer space/portion is very tiny, so don’t plan on bringing more than maybe 1-2 items that need to be frozen (depending on their size).
From the pictures, I wasn’t expecting too much from the bed, but was so pleasantly surprised when I laid down on it for the first time to test it out and then later slept like a baby each night! It feels like it’s one of those boxed memory foam mattresses.
TV and Wi-Fi worked great! Some other Airbnb’s I’ve stayed at have Netflix and other streaming apps, but make you log into your own account (which I guess I can understand), but no need to worry about that in this rental, Netflix was readily available!
CONS:
I don’t think “cons” is really an appropriate title for this section of the review, because I don’t really have anything negative to say. However, I felt I should make note of some things that weren’t an issue for me, but may be important to other potential renters…
There is an adjacent rental and the two rentals can be accessed by an adjoining door. This would be great for a family or group that wants to rent out both sides and want or need easy access into the other rental. However, because of this door (I’m assuming it’s the door 🤷🏻‍♀️), I could hear adults and children speaking in normal tones on the other side, so if you’re someone that would be irritated by that or are a light sleeper, this rental might not be your best option unless no one’s renting the other side. BUT, the amount of times I heard noises or speaking were minimal and I’m not a light sleeper, so it didn’t bother me at all. But, it did make me conscious of “the other side” hearing MY conversations, though lol.
Another “con, but not con” 😄 is the location of the rental. If you’re planning on spending most of your time in any of the towns that are 20+ mins away and do not have your own transportation, this location may not be the best option for you…just depends on what you’re willing to spend.
I flew into Ogdensburg airport and planned on spending the majority of my time in Ogdensburg, so I ended up spending a good amount on George….aka the ONLY Uber driver in the area 😂. (BTW, George’s phone number is (315) 323-1877, if you need or prefer Uber). I called a cab company just to see how much the same trip would cost and they said $83, which was a significant difference compared to the $27-33 I was paying Uber. With all my trips, I ended up spending almost $150...I probably should’ve looked into renting a car. However, I had previously looked at the price per night for this rental and added it with how much I would spend on Uber a day and, for me, it still made more sense to stay at Ben’s and pay the cost for an Uber, because you are essentially getting your own studio apartment vs. the in-town Airbnb options (in Ogdensburg), which only offer you a private room and cost more than double the price per night.
Paying $115/night to stay in town and only getting a private room, in addition to, having to share the common areas with strangers (especially with Covid still going around) and then still having to pay someone for transportation, didn’t make sense to me.
All-in-all, I would 100% recommend renting this suite. I had a very nice, relaxing stay and definitely plan on renting with them again for any future trips, as well as, suggesting this rental to other friends who may be going to visit the area!
